statement.tex: \\ \text{If }\dfrac{3x-1}{(x+2)^2} = \dfrac{A}{x+2} + \dfrac{B}{(x+2)^2},\\ \text{then what are the values of A and B?}

reason.tex: \begin{align} \dfrac{3x-1}{(x+2)^2} &= \dfrac{A}{x+2} + \dfrac{B}{(x+2)^2} \\ \implies 3x - 1 &= A\cdot(x+2) + B = Ax + (2A + B) \end{align} \\ \text{On comparing coefficients, we get } \\ A = 3 \text{ and } 2A+B = -1\implies B = -7.
